name: Southernmost on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got married in Key West and stayed at Southernmost on the Beach. We had the best time. Our room was beautiful, room 636 I believe. The balcony was over the ocean and we spent many nights having wine on our balcony and watching the jet skiers and the watching the sun set. The hotel staff was excellent, from check in, turn down service, maid service and the spa. We met some interesting locals at the beach restaurant on the property and the food was good. The hotel is peaceful and quiet and a short walk to all the fun on Duval. We will definatley be back next year for our anniversary.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay to relax and enjoy Key West.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a fantastic time at the Southernmost on the Beach Resort in Key West, FL. The room was exactly what it looked like in the photos. Diana at the Front Desk was very accommodating when we asked for an ocean view room after we booked a garden view room. She allowed us to go into the ocean view room and take a look around before deciding. The pool was a very popular hangout and we enjoyed meeting other guests. The pool being open until 11pm was nice to take a late night dip. There was also live music at the pool each day. Emmett, the pool bartender was also very cool. The bed was comfortable, but maybe could have been a bit softer. The rooms were very clean. The hotel is within a short walk to Duval Street. We rented bicycles ($10 a day) and enjoyed getting around town that way. The public beach adjacent to the hotel is a bit to be desired, but not bad in comparison to the other beaches on Key West.
reviews.title: Tremendous Experience
Great Stay
reviews.text: Me and my wife went here for our 2 year anniversary from NYC. We had a really nice stay. The property is really beautiful. We actually stayed in 2 rooms because it was so full over memorial day weekend. We were in an ocean view for 4 nights and spent the 5th in one of the standard rooms. The ocean view room was a much nicer and newer room and was definitely 4 star hotel quality, but the other was closer to a 3. Otherwise the rest of the property feels like a brand new 3.5 star hotel as it is rated. Its nice, down to earth. It has a super fun pool area and is right next to a cute little beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For us the location couldn't be better. If you are looking to key west for a quieter couple's trip than look no further for a hotel. Rip roaring hard partiers are probably better at the other end of duval street where they can be a little closer to the action.
reviews.title: Talk about Fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had the best time at this hotel! The pool was spectacular, it was a block from Duval , had a beach, restruant on premisis that was open with a water view for conveninet breakfasts, amazing pool and pool bar . There were all sorts of fun things like Free Beer School, Free Wine school, live music by the pool, contest with free give aways, raffle drawings by the pool with free give aways. Our room was amazing and clean and the maids were fantastic. They left extra towels if requested and when we arrived , there was a bottle of champaigne delivered to our room because we booked through perfect getaways. Boomer and Kathy Nyugen were amazing employees . A paper was delievered every morning to our room and , there was free coffee in the morning! The hotel had tons of bike rentals that were cheap and, it was a really clean property! The conscierge offered to take calls after she left to book us for snorkeling, and last but not least, there were water dispensers and ice dispensers for unmilited free water! I'd go back in a heart beat and recommend it to anyone I know.
reviews.title: Favorite Place...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in June 2011. Room was small and very plain considering the price. The clientele was a party crowd. This can be a plus for some. The grounds were undergoing upgrades and pool maintenance was underway as well. Noisy. The room door opened to the outside? Dangerous to passersby which are numerous.
reviews.title: Not your typical $300+ plus room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, if you're looking for the most for your dollar and/or a restful vacation with a tasteful setting there are much better options.
reviews.title: Outstanding...Already booked again for next year.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything about our stay at the Sourthernmost on the Beach in Key West was wonderful...We could not have asked for more from the front desk and concierge to the staffs of housekeeping, restaurant, bar and pool. A truly memorable vacation.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I, travelled with my sister and brother in law to the Southermost on the Beach end of April and beginning of May. This resort was absolutely wonderful. Our room...in my opinion...was the best in the resort. Our room was on the end and just a few feet from the ocean. We had a private little deck with nice beach chairs that we could sit out in the evening we a glass of wine and enjoy the nice ocean breeze and the sunset. The rooms were absolutely cleaned to perfection. Bed was nice and comfortable. Loved the nice big bathroom with the BeeNice bathroom products. Cant recommend this resort enough! Just as an FYI...we had a problem with the safe...which was totally our mistake...called the front desk and someone was in our room within 5 minutes to patiently explain how we had not engaged the safe correctly. What customer service!!!!
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights in June 2011. Stayed in Bldg B-partial ocean view room. The room was a luxurious room with very comfy beds, huge showers, plenty of room, balcany with a nice view of the ocean. The beach is very nice with free beach chairs for hotel guests. The also rent umbrellas, stand-up paddle boards. We ate at the Southermost Cafe for lunch. Very good food but a little expensive. The Hotel is on the quiet end of Duval only 2 blocks from the southernmost buoy. We walked from the hotel to the other end of Duval street many times. The only problem we had was the service at the pool side desk where you get towels, game equipment(ping pong,bean bags,ladder golf). Almost everytime we went to get towels or game equipment nobody was around and the bartenders totally ignored you so playing games or getting towels is next to impossible. The hotel is very well maintained and the area around the property is beatifull!! The swimming pool was always crowded but your allowed to use the pools across the street at the southernmost hotel. Those pools were less crowded and very nice. We would stay here again. Good place for couples.
reviews.title: Great hotel
just as beautiful as web-site shows
reviews.text: the staff is excellent. rooms are beautiful and large. huge flat screen tv. great view from balcony. excellent bar staff. excellent cafe with full menu. get it? it is definitely the place to stay! the view and the entire layout is perfect. there are quiet places to rest or enjoy others by the pool.

reviews.title: amazing stay---perfect room, service, views
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from Southernmost on the Beach. From our check-in to the cab ride back to the airport, our experience was excellent. We found our king bed/ocean front room to be impeccably decorated, equipped and cleaned. The large windows and doors to the balcony looking out on the ocean made it especially memorable. One of the few beaches on Key West was just steps away, the beach chairs on the pier, and the friendly pool and pool bar all made relaxation here even more effortless. I would highly recommend this as a great place to stay when visiting Key West.

reviews.title: Sitting on the dock....
reviews.text: A lovely place that we hope to return to. The staff was excellent, especially the concierges who went out of their ways to find us restaurants and reserve bikes, snorkel trips, etc. You can trust their suggestions. Large, quiet, airy rooms and a lovely dock that extends out into the sea and gets nice breezes. (Grab a chair early in the morning!) Excellent location, too. We only had a few gripes. The largest was the blaring music poolside. This is always a problem at resorts like this because the bartenders and waitresses like to have the noise, though I'm sure it annoys more than half the guests. Ask in the front office to have them turn it down. The restaurant is mediocre and a little grim, but useful at lunchtime. (Lousy breakfast.) And note that the rooms with 'ocean view' only have a partial view unless you get the large suite. Not that it matters if you're out by the beautiful water. All in all, a great experience, though not at all a bargain.

reviews.title: Super convenient location with breathtaking views and awesome service.
reviews.text: I love Southernmost Hotel and Southernmost hotel on the Beach. Their service is outstanding and the rooms are super clean. The staff are so wonderful, accomodating, friendly, and all have great personalities. I would never stay anywhere else in Key West even if my other location was paid for. This was our second time there and we loved the location the first time, that we decided to stay there again and get married on Southernmost Beach. The wedding coordinator (Melissa) was absolutely wonderful. She made the whole experience for us very relaxing. Our guests also loved the Southernmost Hotel so much, that I am SURE they will be going back. We will be going back there again, but not soon enough. I cannot say one negative thing about this place. Everything there was perfect from check-in to check-out.

reviews.title: This is Heaven
reviews.text: Just stayed at this property for the third time! Everytime in a different section, and always amazed! The staff is also great! The Beach Cafe has great food, and right there. It is a good walk down Duval, but as long as the sun isn't out, it is a very enjoyable stroll. We just took a cab down and walked home. Go to Louies Backyard...The Afterdeck for drinks on the beach...it is very close by. The pool at night is so refreshing and they play great music...Jack Johnson, just very chill. The rooms are fabulous. I cannot say enough, and will be back next year.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach for a much-needed escape from a miserable northeastern winter/spring. Chose SMOTB for its location--which is perfect for all Key West activities. All rooms have ocean views, but splurge for the oceanfront rooms--you will not be disappointed. Something to be said for relaxing on your private balcony overlooking water that seems painted from a palette of heavenly blues and greens. Rooms themselves are magnificent, nicely appointed and comfortable. Staff could not be friendlier or more helpful with any/every request. Great front desk staff, concierge, restaurant personnel, cleaning crew, pool attendants (say hi to Cella--she's the best!). You can relax at the pool, on the beach right outside your door or on the very cool tanning pier, from which you can take a dip in the aforementioned water by simply walking down some stairs. You're a two-minute walk from the Southernmost Point in the U.S., and an easy stroll to Duval St., with its myriad bars and restaurants and unmatched people-watching opportunities. In fact, you can pretty much walk anywhere in Old Town Key West from here, including to Mallory Square for the famous sunset celebrations. Hadn't been to Key West in some 20 years, but after staying at SMOTB, can't wait to get back. No place else we'd ever stay. The location and amenenities makes this hotel ideal, but its people and their level of service really make it something special. Just a great trip. Truly a slice of heaven in paradise.
reviews.title: Perfection in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon in Key West, where we spent 5 nights at the Southernmost on the Beach. Not only was it one of the most affordable resorts on the island for what you get, it was downright beautiful. Our room was immaculate, and looked EXACTLY what the pictures look like of the new rooms. The pool and green area were a great place to relax, and the dock even has steps down into the ocean where people snorkeled in about 4 feet of water. Though we didn't get to eat at the restaurant right there at the beach, we did enjoy several drinks at the bar, and did get to rent a surf board where we paddled out into the water for a good hour of relaxation.
reviews.title: The perfect place for a honeymoon in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is about a mile to a mile and a half from Mallory Square, but it was nice to come back to the quiet end of the street at the end of the night. The concierge was ready to give us tips and even book our sunset cruise for us which was a great help since neither one of us had vacationed there before.
reviews.title: I would stay again in a heartbeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I could go on and on about how much we enjoyed our vacation, but to sum it up, we will go to SMOTB every time we go back to Key West!
reviews.title: can't say enough!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I just got back from a week at the Southernmost on the Beach and cannot say enough about the hotel. We were greeted by wonderful hotel staff from the front desk (Hector) to the pool (Gizella). We stayed in the newer King oceanview rooms and have never felt so comfortable in a hotel room. They were clean, large, and I wish I had that shower and bed here at home. The pool was great and the Southernmost on the Beach Cafe was excellent. We ate there alot and everything was delicious. Kathy and Brian were great servers and we had alot of fun with them. Our flight out was cancelled and we were given a room across the street and the Southernmost Hotel and did not like that nearly as well. The staff was just as wonderful, but the hotel needs to be updated. I will definately stay at the Southernmost on the Beach again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Misleading Advertising, Rude Front Office

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a relaxing weekend at Southernmost. We booked an ocean view room, not one of the newly remodeled rooms, but still beautiful! We were in room 605 overlooking the pool and the beach. It was very clean and the view was spectacular!
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about the hotel staff. Everyone we had the pleasure of dealing with was friendly and helpful. We truly felt pampered. Brain who supplied us with beach chairs was great! He brought us towel-cicles, sprayed our feet with cool water and gave us a cup of frozen fruit to enjoy. All of it made a very HOT day more pleasant.
reviews.title: Perfect location in Key West! Beach, Duval St., Great Rooms!
Great resort in Key West
reviews.text: The location is wonderful also! It's nice to be on the quiet end of Duval St and the walk to Mallory Square is easy. The only suggestion I could possibly make would be for the hotel to offer room service. It was nice, however, to have a small fridge in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our time at Southernmost was not nearly long enough so we are already planning a return trip!
reviews.title: Nice Location, Chill Atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I can not compliment this hotel enough. First, the location is perfect. The hotel is on the water with a beach and while being in Old Towne Key West but at the quiter end of Duval St. This is the best of both worlds; on the water and within walking distance to the Key West attractions. There is also a very nice pool. Second, the hotel rooms were clean and comfortable. We stayed in the older section of the hotel and it was very nice. Lastly, the staff were great and the Conceirge was very helpful. There are also, onsite bike and scooter rentals which we took advantage of.
reviews.title: Great *new* room - OK location. Would stay again for right price...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I usually stay at nicer hotels; Omni, Hilton, Waldof Astoria. This hotel was beautiful and a great value. I've paid a lot more for a lot less. Beautiful room, great customer service, and very helpful concerge.
reviews.title: great all around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed in Building B.. Partial ocean view. Room was luxurious. Great Beds,.Huge Shower. Nice property on quiet end of Duval..but GREAT LOCATION!!! Its a nice walk down Duval and back up. Butterfly World and the great 90 miles to cuba buoy. The beach was nice, a lil seaweedy . Beach cafe was yummy. No room service!! When Im on vacay thats one thing I like. Staff was nice. Front desk was a bit S-L-O-W. They should have check out on their TVs. As we stood in line what seemed forever to check out . Pool was nice. Not enough chairs, but there is no room to improve this anyway. Southernmost has a few buildings, the hotel and beach properties are completely different. On the beach is way nicer compared to the hotel which seemed unimpressive.Overall the property was nice a lil pricey though for what was not offered. Be aware-If you have lil ones, there wasnt much for them to do..no kiddie pool or play area. It would be nice to have a designated area for children.
reviews.title: Nice Place ,but not the best with lil ones

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having booked at a different hotel first, I realized there was no beach at the available. After looking around and asking around I figured Southernmost on the Beach has the largest (only a hundred feet) private beach.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for your stay in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a great, great hotel. Very clean and modern rooms. Staff is incredibly helpful. On site activities were great. We did the wine tasting and were happy with it. Concierge is really helpful in booking activities off the resort.
reviews.title: Can't imagine staying anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couples massage that we got was OK, probably worth the money. I do recommend the happy hour at the cafe on the beach for very cheap drinks/appetizers every day
reviews.title: wonderful hotel
Best Trip Ever
reviews.text: Stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach and it was one of the best places we have stayed from start to finish. The staff were helpful and so upbeat, from the check in staff, to the bartender, to the cleaning staff. We had our luggage shipped there and it was waiting for us in our room. We had Room 53 which has to be one of the best rooms in the place - Own private patio with the most beautiful view.

reviews.title: Great Hotel in a good location
reviews.text: Hammocks on the grounds, great pool, great location - definitely walking distance to everything. Can't wait to go back!!!

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: This is a lovely location , it is exactly as shown on their website. We loved Key West, it had a lovely atmosphere and plenty do. Lots of great restaurants. Would definatley stay here again!

reviews.title: Best spot ever! Best one you can imagine in the area!
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel in Key West. Everything was perfekt. Thanks for a great weekend.

reviews.title: Much too expensive for what it is...
reviews.text: Beach where Tennessee Williams used to swim. Marveloussly turquoise water. Palms, hammocks, incredibly white sand, fantastic swimming pool, charming staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: We stayed in room 517 which is a west lawn room. Originally requested second floor room but after seeing location [next to housekeeping storage] moved to a lower level and it was perfect. Close to pool, beach, swimming/sun pier, and beautiful view from the chairs outside our door. Worth the cost. Property is nicely laid out so it seemed all rooms conveniently located.
reviews.title: Close to Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze and will store your belongings until room is ready. Same goes for check-out.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation at the Southernmost on the beach !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel not overrun with kids!!! Nice atmosphere at the pool. Heather the server was great. Very friendly.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and rooms...great vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice happy hour. $3 drinks and apps. Loved tuna sliders.
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If your looking to be in a party place this isnt your hotel. It is at end of Duval away from the party bars but a nice walk after dinner w places to stop for quiter after dinner beverages. Dinner must are Santiagos for tapas and El Siboney for Cuban.
reviews.title: Beautifully Done

aka: Southernmost On The Beach Hotel Key West
description: Located where Duval street meets the Atlantic Ocean in historic old town, Southernmost on the Beach stretches out on a secluded section of the island, away from the hustle of Key West activities, but close enough to the excitement when you want it. Complimenting our collection of dynamic hotels in historic Key West, Southernmost on the Beach’s private pier offers a front row seat to the Atlantic Ocean’s spectacular sunrises and winter sunsets.
